 E:  a and b
176.answer_content: The conscientious, explicit and judicious best evidence in making decisions about the care of the individual patient

177.query:
High risk choriocarcinoma is treated by:
 A:  Methotrexate plus external beam pelvic radiation
 B:  EMACO combination chemotherapy
 C:  Methotrexate single agent therapy
 D:  Methotrexate plus radical hysterectomy plus external beam pelvic radiation
 E:  External hysterectomy

178.query:
The following are true of placenta praevia except;
 A:  The first haemorrhage is often less severe than subsequent haemorrhages.
 B:  Blood is often fresh and bright red
 C:  Type II anterior, spontaneous vaginal delivery is anticipated
 D:  Type Il posterior, spontaneous vaginal anticipated
 E:  Pain is not common feature
178.answer_content: Type Il posterior, spontaneous vaginal anticipated

179.query:
The following can be used to effectively suppress lactation for HIV mothers opting not to breastfeed after delivery.
 A:  Depo provera
 B:  Progestion
 C:  Frusemide
 D:  Carbergeline
 E:  Estriol

180.query:
The following are risk factors for cancer of the cervix except:
 A:  Early coitarche
 B:  Human papilloma virus
 C:  Infertility
 D:  Multiple sexual partners
 E:  Presence of ulcerative genital tract disease

181.query:
Leiomyoma is commonly associated with:
 A:  Intermenstrual spotting
 B:  Menorrhagia
 C:  Dyspareunia
 D:  Dysmenorrhoea
 E:  Frequency of micturition

182.query:
An 18 years old presents with history of urinary leakage per vagina after a recent difficult labour. A dye test performed revealed clear urine in the vagina. The diagnosis is;
 A:  Utero- cervico vaginal fistula
 B:  Vesico- vaginal fistula
 C:  Urethral - vaginal fistula
 D:  Uretero-vaginal fistula
 E:  Rectovaginal fistula

183.query:
The commonest site for metastatic trophoblastic disease is;
 A:  Vagina
 B:  Brain
 C:  Lungs
 D:  Ovaries
 E:  Rectum

184.query:
A para 6+0 mother develops postpartum haemerrhage immediately after delivery. 
All the following are correct concerning her management except;
 A:  Take her immediately for emergency hysterectomy
 B:  Start oxytocin drip
 C:  Cytotec use is beneficial
 D:  Massage of uterus is beneficial
 E:  Examination without anaesthesia should inform examination with anaesthesia
184.answer_content: Take her immediately for emergency hysterectomy

185.query:
In twin pregnancy which of the following combination of fetal presentation may be complicated by interlocked twins;
 A:  1st twin cephalic- 2nd twin cephalic
 B:  1st twin cephalic -2nd twin breach
 C:  1st twin breach- 2 twin breach
 D:  1st twin breach -2nd twin cephalic
 E:  1st twin cephalic -2nd twin transverse

186.query:
The normal average baseline fetal heart rate at term is;
 A:  110-150 bpm
 B:  100-140-bpm
 C:  120-160 bpm
 D:  120-140 bpm
 E:  130-150 bpm

187.query:
A 20 years old para 0+0 at 38 weeks gestation with a B. P 160/110 multg, severe headache and one episode of convulsion one hour ago. Obsteric examination revealed a term fundal height, cephalic presentation and fetal heart rate of 144/min. The cervix is closed 2 cm long, posterior and not effaced. What would be your next plan of action?
 A:  Start magnesium sulphate intravenous hydralazine and prepare for emergency caesarean section delivery
 B:  Start magnesium sulphate then control blood pressure with I.V hydrallazine and insert postraglandin pessary.
 C:  Start intravenous valium, hydrallazine drip and prepare for emergency caesarean section delivery.
 D:  Start intravenous labetalel drip and prepare for emergency ceasarean section delivery
 E:  Start intravenous labetalol and insert prostaglandin pessary
187.answer_content: Start magnesium sulphate intravenous hydralazine and prepare for emergency caesarean section delivery

188.query:
All are normal semenalysis findings except;
 A:  Liquefaction by 30 minutes
 B:  Sperm count 18 million/ml
 C:  Motility 60%
 D:  Volume 3ml
 E:  Morphology 30% normal

189.query:
A 28 years old woman presents with hirsutism, irregular cycle and obesity. Her testosterone level was mildly elevated. Which of the following is the most likely aetiology
 A:  Diabetes
 B:  Cushings syndrome
 C:  Sheerhans syndrome
 D:  Polycystic ovarian disease
 E:  None of the above

190.query:
The most commonly used contraception in Kenya is:
 A:  Pills
 B:  Mesigyno
 C:  Jadelle
 D:  Depo medroxy progesterone acetate
 E:  IUCD

191.query:
Which of the following is true regarding oval combined contraceptives;
 A:  Contains estradiol and estrone
 B:  Skipping four pills warrants introduction of emergency contraception(postinor)
 C:  Is administered for 28 days then after menses start
 D:  Confers antifertility effects through inhibition of ovulation
 E:  About 10% of users will develop hypertention.
191.answer_content: Confers antifertility effects through inhibition of ovulation

192.query:
The following characterises the pathophysiology of preeclampsia;
 A:  Vasodilation
 B:  Haemodilation
 C:  Vasospasm
 D:  Hyponatremia
 E:  Hypovolemia

193.query:
The cutoff CD4 count below which patients should be commenced on treatment for their own health regardless of trimester is below or equal to:
 A:  150
 B:  200
 C:  250
 D:  300
 E:  350

194.query:
Which of the following is associated with malpresentation;
 A:  Oligohydramnios
 B:  Hyperthyroidism
 C:  Uterine fibroids
 D:  Primigravidae
 E:  Sickle cell disease

195.query:
A 29 years old 40 weeks gestation reports to labour ward with maternal exhaustion. Examining her cervix to be 3 cm dilated and partially effaced. A decision to induce her. How would you proceed?
 A:  Insert a forleys catheter extra amniotic under traction then observe for labour
 B:  Start oxytocin drip
 C:  Perform artificial rupture of membranes and if clear start oxytocin drop
 D:  Insert prostaglandin pessary then perform artificial rupture of membranes
 E:  Insert misoprostol 25mg into posterior fornix then review after 4 hours
195.answer_content: Insert misoprostol 25mg into posterior fornix then review after 4 hours

196.query:
Which of the following is positively associated with preterm birth?
 A:  Bacteria vaginosis
 B:  Trichomonas vaginalis
 C:  Candidiasis
 D:  Herps simplex
 E:  Lactobacilli

197.query:
A 30-year-old underweight a cardiotocograph (CTG) due to induction for reduced fetal movements. A drop in the fetal heart rate was observed only during the contractions and both were mirror images. This phenomenon is referred to as;
 A:  Early deceleration
 B:  Late deceleration
 C:  Variable deceleration
 D:  Early acceleration
 E:  Late acceleration

198.query:
The Jadelle implant confers contraception after insertion for a duration of;
 A:  Three years
 B:  Four years
 C:  Two years
 D:  Five years
 E:  Eight years

199.query:
The following statement is true concerning ectopic pregnancy
 A:  Absence of vaginal bleeding excludes diagnosis
 B:  Presence of vaginal shoulder tip pain indicates rupture
 C:  Characteristic feature is marked vaginal bleeding
 D:  Symptoms mainly manifest at 16 weeks gestation
 E:  Is mainly diagnosed by beta HCG assay
199.answer_content: Presence of vaginal shoulder tip pain indicates rupture

200.query:
The following contraceptive is contraindicated in patients with stage iv HIV disease.
 A:  Combined oral contraceptive
 B:  Progestin only contraceptive.
 C:  Depot medroxy progesterone acetate
 D:  Levornogestral implant
 E:  Intrauterine contraceptive Device (IUCD)

201.query:
The following is known to prevent congenital neural tube defects
 A:  Vitamin A
 B:  Vitamin B
 C:  Vitamin B12
 D:  Folic acid
 E:  Folinic acid

202.query:
When conducting fetal kick chart, the normal number of kick chart is;
 A:  Kick charts in twelve hours
 B:  Ten kick charts in twelve hours
 C:  Ten rolling movement in twelve hours
 D:  All of the above
 E:  None of the above
202.answer_content: Ten kick charts in twelve hours

203.query:
A mother at 36 weeks gestation is confirmed to have fetal growth restriction. The management will be;
 A:  Start mother on parenteral feeds
 B:  Increase the dose of maternal nutritional supplements
 C:  Administer high-calorie diet to the mother for the next four weeks
 D:  Deliver the baby
 E:  None of the above

204.query:
All of the following is associated with pregnancy except;
 A:  Hemorrhoids
 B:  Ptyalism
 C:  Pica
 D:  Hypernatreamia
 E:  Constipation

205.query:
The stretch marks noted in the abdominal skin and breast during pregnancy is referred to as;
 A:  Striae albicantes
 B:  Striae gravidavum
 C:  Malasma
 D:  Linea alba
 E:  Linea nigra

206.query:
A 28-year-old presents with a pap smear result reaching HSIL. Which of the following is the most appropriate management strategy?
 A:  Exam and a pap smear in one year's time
 B:  Colposcopy with endocervical curetting for histology
 C:  Cryotherapy
 D:  Loop electrosurgical excision procedure (LEEP) OR cervical conization
 E:  Hysterectomy
206.answer_content: Colposcopy with endocervical curetting for histology

207.query:
Which of the following investigations would be most helpful in assessing the extent of ovarian cancer?
 A:  MRI of the abdomen and pelvis
 B:  CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
 C:  Chest X-ray
 D:  Ca 125
 E:  Intravenous pyelography
207.answer_content: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis

208.query:
A 32-year-old Para 2+1 presents with one year history amenorrhea following evacuation of the uterus due to septic incomplete abortion. Her hormonal profile is normal. What is the likely diagnosis
 A:  Premature menopause
 B:  latrogenic ovarian failure
 C:  Hypothalamic pituitary amenorrhea
 D:  Sheehan's syndrome
 E:  Asherman's syndrome

209.query:
A Para 1+1 with no living children has a D & C for a partial molar pregnancy. The couple would like to conceive as soon as possible. Which of the following is the appropriate recommendation to them?
 A:  Attempt pregnancy 2 months after D&cx
 B:  Attempt pregnancy once beta-HCG normalizes
 C:  Avoid pregnancy for 3 years
 D:  Use Depo Provera contraceptive for one year then conceive
 E:  Attempt conception 6 months after a negative beta HCG level
209.answer_content: Attempt conception 6 months after a negative beta HCG level

210.query:
The most common site for an ectopic pregnancy is;
 A:  Fimbrial
 B:  Cornu
 C:  Isthmus
 D:  Ampulla
 E:  Ovarian

211.query:
The partograph is used to prevent all the following EXCEPT:
 A:  Delayed third stage of labour
 B:  Fetal distress
 C:  Maternal death
 D:  Puerperal sepsis
 E:  Obstructed labour

212.query:
Which of the following explanations would justify delayed cord clamping in the third stage of labour?
 A:  To facilitate delivery of the placenta
 B:  To prevent birth asphyxia
 C:  To facilitate resuscitation of the baby
 D:  To improve bonding between the mother and her baby
 E:  To prevent anaemia in the baby
212.answer_content: To prevent anaemia in the baby

213.query:
Which of the following diameters is associated with full flexion of the fetal head at engagement?
 A:  Submentobregmatic diameter
 B:  Mentovertical diameter
 C:  Suboccipitobregmatic diameter
 D:  Occipitofrontal diameter
 E:  Suboccipitofrontal diameter

214.query:
The loading dose of magnesium sulfate is given via
 A:  I.V over 5 minutes, followed by deep I.M injection into each button
 B:  I.V over 5 minutes followed by deep I.M injection into one buttock
 C:  Simultaneous I.V and I.M injections
 D:  I.V bolus, followed by deep I.M injection into each buttock
 E:  a and c
214.answer_content: I.V over 5 minutes, followed by deep I.M injection into each button

215.query:
Diastolic blood pressure 90 mmitg or more before 20 weeks of gestation is symptomatic of;
 A:  Mild pre-eclampsia
 B:  Chronic hypertension
 C:  Superimposed mild pre-eclampsia
 D:  Pregnancy-induced hypertension
 E:  All of the above

216.query:
Regarding Fertilization & implantation:
 A:  Fertilization occurs in the inner third of the fallopian tube.
 B:  The sperm head penetrates through the corona radiata & zona pellucida while the tail remains outside.
 C:  The 2nd meiotic division is completed before fertilization.
 D:  Implantation occurs at the morula stage.
 E:  The trophoblast invades the endometrium & differentiates into an outer cytotrophoblast & an inner syncytiotrophoblast
216.answer_content: The sperm head penetrates through the corona radiata & zona pellucida while the tail remains outside.

217.query:
Mrs. Aketch came to the antenatal clinic at 32 weeks gestation feeling dizzy and weak. Laboratory investigations revealed she has anaemia. The MOST likely type of anaemia would be:
 A:  Iron deficiency anaemia
 B:  Physiological anaemia
 C:  Anemia due to ascaris lumbricoides
 D:  Megaloblastic anaemia
 E:  Haemolytic anaemia

218.query:
When performing abdominal aortic compression to control postpartion hemorrhage, the point of compression
 A:  Just below and slightly to the right of the umbilicus
 B:  Just below and slightly to the left of the umbilicus
 C:  Just above and slightly to the right of the umbilicus
 D:  Just above and slightly to the left of the umbilicus
 E:  None of the above
218.answer_content: Just above and slightly to the left of the umbilicus

219.query:
Immediate postpartum hemorrhage can be due to, except;
 A:  Atonic uterus
 B:  Trauma to the genital
 C:  Retained placenta
 D:  All of the above
 E:  Administration of tranexamic acid

220.query:
If manual removal of the placenta is performed
 A:  Give ergometrine prior to the procedure
 B:  Give antibiotics 24 hrs after the procedure
 C:  Place one hand in the uterus and use the other hand to apply traction on the cord
 D:  Place one hand in the uterus and one hand on the abdomen to provide counter traction on the uterine fundus
 E:  All of the above
220.answer_content: Place one hand in the uterus and one hand on the abdomen to provide counter traction on the uterine fundus

221.query:
If the uterus is inverted following childbirth all of the following are true except;
 A:  The uterine fundus is felt on abdominal palpation
 B:  There may be slight or intense pain
 C:  The inverted uterus may be apparent at the valve
 D:  The uterine fundus is not felt on abdominal palpation-
 E:  None of the above
221.answer_content: The uterine fundus is felt on abdominal palpation

222.query:
When diagnosing iron deficiency anaemia which one of the following applies?
 A:  Serum ferritin is more than 12 g/dL
 B:  Lead is less than 20 g/dL.
 C:  Free erythrocyte protoporphyrin greater than 35 g/dL.
 D:  B12, B6, folate levels are increased.
 E:  Serum iron binding capacity may double
222.answer_content: Serum iron binding capacity may double

223.query:
Tears of the cervix, vagina or perineum should be suspected when there is immediate postpartum hemorrhage and;
 A:  A complete placenta and a contracted uterus
 B:  An incomplete placenta and a contracted uterus
 C:  A complete placenta and an atonic uterus
 D:  An incomplete placenta and an atonic uterus
 E:  All of the above
223.answer_content: A complete placenta and a contracted uterus

224.query:
Disseminated intravascular coagulopathy is suspected following when bedside clotting test is done if;
 A:  Bleeding fails to stop within 7 minutes from a 1mm incision made on the inner aspect of a forearm
 B:  A clot fails to form within 7 minutes when calcium gluconet is added to a 3ml test tube of blood
 C:  A clot forms within 7 minutes
 D:  A clot fails to form after 7 minutes or a soft clot form that breaks down easily
 E:  Clot form but pale in colour.
224.answer_content: A clot fails to form after 7 minutes or a soft clot form that breaks down easily

225.query:
The MVA procedure is complete when
 A:  The wall of the uterus feels smooth
 B:  The vacuum in the syringe decreases
 C:  Red or pink foam, but no more tissue is aspirated
 D:  The uterus relaxes
 E:  When the patient feels minimum pain?
225.answer_content: Red or pink foam, but no more tissue is aspirated

226.query:
Mrs Musa is a postnatal mother who is showing a lot of interest in taking care of her baby. Regarding the psychological phases of puerperium, she is in the:
 A:  Taking-in phase
 B:  Taking-on phase
 C:  Taking-hold phase
 D:  Letting-go phase
 E:  Anxiety phase

227.query:
The following are findings of fetal hydrops except
 A:  Scalp edema
 B:  Ascites
 C:  Pericardial effusion
 D:  Enlarged bladder
 E:  Pleural effusion

228.query:
Which one of the following interventions is NOT advised during vaginal term delivery of a patient with mitral stenosis?
 A:  Ergometrine injection.
 B:  Frusemide (Lasix) injection.
 C:  Vacuum delivery
 D:  Oxygen by mask
 E:  Oxytocin injection

229.query:
Which of the following criteria is not used in the WHO prognostic scoring system for choriocarcinoma?
 A:  Age of the patient
 B:  Serum levels of beta hCG.
 C:  Patient's ABO blood group
 D:  Metastases to the lungs
 E:  Size of largest tumour

230.query:
One of the following statements is correct about vulval and vaginal conditions
 A:  Desquamative inflammatory vaginitis occurs mainly in the postmenopausal women.
 B:  The causative organism in Toxic Shock Syndrome is streptococcus
 C:  Vaginal discharge is the commonest presentation of foreign body in the vagina amongst toddlers
 D:  Vulval warts in 3rd trimester is treated by cauterization to allow for a vaginal delivery.
 E:  Stab incision followed by drainage of pus, is the advocated treatment of Bartholin's abscess
230.answer_content: Vaginal discharge is the commonest presentation of foreign body in the vagina amongst toddlers

231.query:
A pregnant woman who has severe anaemia typically presents with
 A:  Wheezing
 B:  Rhonchi
 C:  Dyspnoea
 D:  Spider naevi
 E:  Microscopic haematuria

232.query:
The information obtained from the antenatal history can help the provider
 A:  Plan for child birth
 B:  Identify existing problems
 C:  Identify health education and counselling needs
 D:  All of the above
 E:  None of above

233.query:
The preferred fetal dimensions for estimating gestational age at 36 to 38 weeks is
 A:  Femur length
 B:  Chest circumference
 C:  Abdominal circumference
 D:  Biparietal diameter
 E:  Crown-rump length

234.query:
The following statements are TRUE about vomiting in pregnancy, EXCEPT:
 A:  May require admission to hospital
 B:  Is commonest in the third trimester
 C:  May be associated with multiple pregnancy
 D:  May be associated with trophoblastic disease
 E:  May be associated with urinary tract infection
234.answer_content: Is commonest in the third trimester

235.query:
Which of the following statements is INCORRECT?
 A:  Oral contraceptive pills delay the onset of menopause.
 B:  Premature menopause is cessation of menstruation before the age of 40
 C:  Menopause is the final menstruation which occurs during the climacteric
 D:  Pre-menopause is the time during climacteric when the menses become irregular
 E:  Climacteric is the phase during which a woman passes from the reproductive stage to non-reproductive stage
235.answer_content: Menopause is the final menstruation which occurs during the climacteric

236.query:
Which of the following statements is correct regarding post-menopause?
 A:  FSH and LH are characteristically low
 B:  A fibroid uterus tends to grow bigger
 C:  The endometrium is characteristically thick on Ultrasonography
 D:  The women have a tendency to get fractures
 E:  Genital atrophy hardly ever occurs
236.answer_content: The women have a tendency to get fractures

237.query:
A 17-year-old, pregnant woman was brought to maternity ward, because was found to have generalized convulsion at the central market. O/E: (positive finding) unconscious, pale +, BP 156/100 mmHg, hyperreflexia, urine dipstick for protein +; F/L 35 cm. V/E Cervix effaced, dilated 4 cm, station –1. How do you manage this patient?
 A:  General measure, prophylactic antibiotic and immediate C/section.
 B:  General measures, antihypertensive, MgSO4, resuscitation of the patient, foetal assessment and emergency c/section.
 C:  General measures, antihypertensive, anticonvulsant and augmentation.
 D:  General measures, BP control, fit control, mother stabilization and conservative management.
 E:  None of the above is true
237.answer_content: General measures, antihypertensive, MgSO4, resuscitation of the patient, foetal assessment and emergency c/section.

238.query:
A 56-year-old lady presented with a small cervical lesion which bled to touch, she reported that she had difficulty closing her left eye. She had nausea and loss of appetite. She had a staring gaze and paresis on the right. No other pelvic lesions were found.
 A:  This is Ca Cervix stage four
 B:  The condition can be diagnosed by ultrasound
 C:  The diagnosis can be suspected from the previous history and confirmed by Laboratory investigations
 D:  She has Burkitt’s lymphoma
 E:  None of the above
238.answer_content: This is Ca Cervix stage four

239.query:
Emily is on Mg SO 4 post-delivery for prevention of eclampsia. Which of the following is NOT a feature of Mg SO 4 toxicity?
 A:  Depressed respiration
 B:  Brisk tendon reflexes
 C:  Diminished tendon reflexes
 D:  Reduced urine output
 E:  None of the above

240.query:
Emily is a primigravida at 37 weeks. She is diagnosed to have pre-eclampsia with severe features. Her BISHOP score is 7 and fetal BPP 10/10. Regarding her delivery plan:
 A:  Induction of labor should be commenced as well as Magnesium sulfate.
 B:  Emergency cesarean section should be done after steroids administration
 C:  Emergency cesarean section should be done immediately
 D:  Induction of labor should be done after administration of Magnesium sulfate (MgSO4)
 E:  None of the above
240.answer_content: Induction of labor should be commenced as well as Magnesium sulfate.

241.query:
Regarding management of Rose what is the major mechanism of action of Low molecular weight heparin?
 A:  Thrombolysis
 B:  Anti-inflammatory
 C:  Anti-thrombin
 D:  Anti-platelet
 E:  None of the above

242.query:
Rose is a primigravida at 24 weeks gestation. Her BMI is 32. She presents with right calf pain and swelling. Which of the following statements regarding her condition is TRUE?
 A:  An elevated D-Dimer is diagnostic
 B:  Real time ultrasonography is the investigation modality of choice.
 C:  The drug of choice is Warfarin
 D:  Hospitalization is not a risk factor of her presentation
 E:  None of the above
242.answer_content: Real time ultrasonography is the investigation modality of choice.

243.query:
Aria is a 24-year-old para 1+0 at 14 weeks, she had a preterm birth with neonatal demise in the previous pregnancy. She has had transvaginal cervical scan indicating a cervical length of 2.4 cm. She is informed of risk of preterm labor later during this pregnancy. Regarding her management, which of the following is appropriate?
 A:  Strict bed rest, oral Salbutamol and Pheobarbitone
 B:  Avoidance of sexual intercourse
 C:  Micronized per vaginal progesterone up to 36 weeks
 D:  Use of Ascard (Aspirin 75mg) once daily up to 28 weeks
 E:  All of the above
243.answer_content: Micronized per vaginal progesterone up to 36 weeks

244.query:
During fetal surveillance:-
 A:  In late decelerations of fetal heart rate, the peak of the contraction occurs after the nadir of the deceleration
 B:  Fetal heart rate increases with increasing gestation
 C:  Placental grading is one of the markers of the biophysical profile (BPP)
 D:  Fetal heart rate accelerations of 15 bpm above baseline rate are a nonreassuring finding
 E:  An early deceleration of the fetal heart rate is a normal finding
244.answer_content: An early deceleration of the fetal heart rate is a normal finding

245.query:
In the Kenyan protocol for the prevention and treatment of malaria in pregnancy, which of the following statements is TRUE?
 A:  Sulfadoxine Pyrimethamine (SP) should not be given concomitantly with antiretrovirals
 B:  The recommended treatment for uncomplicated malaria in the first trimester is a three-day course of artemether lumefantrine (AL)
 C:  Dihydroartemisinin Piperaquine may be used as IPTp for those who are allergic to sulfur
 D:  Sulfadoxine - Pyrimethamine (SP) for IPTp should be given concomitantly with IFAS for prevention of malaria and anaemia in pregnancy.
 E:  The dose of IV quinine for the treatment of severe malaria in pregnancy, should be adjusted in patients with renal insufficiency
245.answer_content: Sulfadoxine - Pyrimethamine (SP) for IPTp should be given concomitantly with IFAS for prevention of malaria and anaemia in pregnancy.

246.query:
When a patient presents with cord prolapse, which of the following statements is 
INCORRECT?
 A:  Funic presentation refers to the cord being below the presenting part, with intact membranes and not palpable on digital vaginal exam.
 B:  If the cord is pulsatile, a rapid cesarean section is the best management for overt prolapse.
 C:  Occult prolapse may be overcome by appropriate positioning of the patient
 D:  A full bladder may avert bad outcomes,
 E:  Avoiding early ARM in patients with high presenting part is advised to prevent cord prolapse.
246.answer_content: Funic presentation refers to the cord being below the presenting part, with intact membranes and not palpable on digital vaginal exam.

247.query:
A 46 years old nulliparous female presents to a fertility clinic with desire to conceive. Her menses have in the recent past been widely spaced and she occasionally experiences hot flushes. A pelvic ultrasound done is reported as normal. Which of the following tests is a useful investigation for ovarian reserve?
 A:  FSH:LH ratio
 B:  Anti-Mullerian Hormone
 C:  Estradiol level
 D:  LH levels
 E:  None of the above

248.query:
Violet, a 36-year-old para 0+2 presents with symptoms innkeeping with Hyperemesis gravidarum. Investigations reveal a uterine snow-storm appearance and hyperthyroidism. Which of the following will explain her presentation?
 A:  Complete Molar pregnancy
 B:  Partial molar pregnancy
 C:  Grave's disease
 D:  Hashimoto's disease
 E:  None of the above

249.query:
Female sexual arousal disorders are defined primarily in terms of a deficiency in a physical or psychological response, and as a result may be caused by a range of physical or psychological factors, including:
 A:  Hormone imbalance
 B:  Diabetes
 C:  Medications being taken for other disorders
 D:  All the above
 E:  None of the above

250.query:
You are called to review Maria, a 17-year-old who has just delivered a 3.9 kg baby and subsequently developed PPH. You perform a quick assessment and find her to have a tear extending from the vagina, to involve the perineal muscles and the anal sphincters (internal and external) without involvement of the anorectal mucosa. Which of the following statements is true about her?
 A:  She disobeyed the midwives hence she suffered the tear
 B:  Secondary repair should be done after 24 hours
 C:  She suffered a 3rd degree tear
 D:  She can be repaired perfectly by an intern on duty
 E:  All of the above

251.query:
Which of the following statements is correct concerning operative abdominal delivery?
 A:  A hemogram, renal function test and grouping/crossmatch are mandatory tests before a caesarian section is done
 B:  Maternal morbidity and mortality from a caesarian section is not higher than vaginal
 C:  There is documented evidence that a classical uterine incision is better than a lower uterine segment transverse incision
 D:  There is no role in prophylactic antibiotics in elective caesarian sections
 E:  The sub-umbilical midline incision is the most popular abdominal entry technique in JOORTH
251.answer_content: A hemogram, renal function test and grouping/crossmatch are mandatory tests before a caesarian section is done

252.query:
A 32-year-old female, known hypertensive patient on losartan/hydrochlorothiazide, presents for pre-conception care, ALL of the following are advised EXCEPT?
 A:  Folic Acid supplementation
 B:  Quit alcohol and cigarette smoking
 C:  Change blood pressure medication to Methyldopa
 D:  Encourage her to take liver at least three times a week to improve iron stores
 E:  Advise her to start ANC when she learns that she is pregnant.
252.answer_content: Encourage her to take liver at least three times a week to improve iron stores

253.query:
In the consideration, evaluation and management of persistent breech presentation:
 A:  When the estimated fetal weight is less than 1500 gms. vaginal delivery is usually without risk
 B:  External Cephalic Version may be offered at 28 weeks with the aim of a consequent vertex delivery
 C:  A well-flexed fetal neck is necessary for a vaginal breech delivery
 D:  The fetal bisacromial diameter is smaller than the intertrochanteric diameter
 E:  The Lovset maneuver is used to overcome head entrapment.
253.answer_content: A well-flexed fetal neck is necessary for a vaginal breech delivery

254.query:
Which of the following patients with primary hyperparathyroidism should undergo parathyroidectomy?
 A:  A 62-year-old asymptomatic woman
 B:  A 54-year-old woman with fatigue and depression
 C:  A 42-year-old woman with a history of kidney stones
 D:  A 60-year-old woman with mildly decreased bone mineral density measured at the hip of less than 2 standard deviations below peak bone density
 E:  A 70-year-old man with recurrent episodes of pancreatitis
254.answer_content: A 42-year-old woman with a history of kidney stones

255.query:
Following surgical resection of a large thyroid mass, a patient complains of persistent hoarseness and a weak voice. What is the most likely cause of these symptoms?
 A:  Traumatic intubation
 B:  Prolonged intubation
 C:  Injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve
 D:  Injury to the superior laryngeal nerve
 E:  Hematoma formation
255.answer_content: Injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve

256.query:
A 1-year-old child presents with crying continuously and drawing his legs up. The mother reports associated episodes of passing bloody mucus per rectum. A long, thin mass is palpable in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen. No peritoneal signs are present. Intussusception is suspected. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?
 A:  Hydrostatic reduction with air enema
 B:  Diagnostic laparoscopy with laparoscopic reduction
 C:  Exploratory laparotomy with bowel resection
 D:  Decompressive colonoscopy with placement of a rectal tube
 E:  Administration of IV fluids and observation

257.query:
Which of the following is a typical cause of neonatal intestinal obstruction?
 A:  Intussusception
 B:  Meconium ileus
 C:  Pyloric stenosis
 D:  Meckel's diverticulum
 E:  Hirschsprung's disease

258.query:
For a 22-kg infant, the maintenance daily fluid requirement is approximately which of the following?
 A:  1100 ml
 B:  1250 ml
 C:  1550 ml
 D:  1700 ml
 E:  1400 ml

259.query:
Which of the following statements regarding nutritional requirements in infants is NOT TRUE?
 A:  The total daily water requirement is estimated to be 100 ml/kg
 B:  The resting energy expenditure is approximately twice that of an adult
 C:  The highest rate of nitrogen retention with parenteral nutrition occurs in infants given approximately 40% of the calories as carbohydrate and the remainder as fat
 D:  The protein requirement for a newborn infant is approximately 1 g/kg/day
 E:  The caloric intake needs to be adjusted based on growth and weight gain
259.answer_content: The protein requirement for a newborn infant is approximately 1 g/kg/day

260.query:
Which of the following statements are TRUE regarding the premature neonate?
 A:  A 15% to 20% right-to-left shunt occurs across the foramen ovale and patent ductus arteriosus
 B:  Surfactant levels are normal after 30 weeks' gestation
 C:  Fluid requirements are lower than in a full-term baby
 D:  Rectal temperature is the best indicator of core body temperature
 E:  Premature neonates have a higher risk of hypoglycemia
260.answer_content: A 15% to 20% right-to-left shunt occurs across the foramen ovale and patent ductus arteriosus

261.query:
Which of the following statements is TRUE of infants with gastroschisis?
 A:  It is not associated with malrotation
 B:  There is a high incidence of associated anomalies
 C:  There is prolonged adynamic ileus following repair
 D:  It is associated with chromosomal syndromes
 E:  It frequently results in complications from infection
261.answer_content: There is prolonged adynamic ileus following repair

262.query:
Which of the following statements is TRUE about infants with gastroschisis?
 A:  It is not associated with malrotation
 B:  There is a high incidence of associated anomalies
 C:  The condition is usually associated wi  th trisomy 21
 D:  It is always linked with maternal alcohol use
 E:  It frequently involves a defect in the umbilical ring
262.answer_content: It is not associated with malrotation

263.query:
The following neonatal conditions are associated with maternal polyhydramnios EXCEPT:
 A:  Esophageal atresia
 B:  Duodenal atresia
 C:  Hirschsprung's disease
 D:  Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
 E:  Anencephaly

264.query:
What injury DOES NOT compromise ventilation?
 A:  Lung contusion
 B:  Open pneumothorax
 C:  Acute cardiac tamponade
 D:  Painful rib fractures
 E:  Flail chest

265.query:
A 72-year-old patient with obesity and superficial varicose veins was admitted to the surgical department with a strangulated large incisional hernia. On the next day after the operation, the patient complained of pain in the left thigh. On day 3 after the operation, during an attempt to stand up, the patient experienced inspiratory dyspnea, dull chest pain, systolic BP of 60 mmHg, and a heart rate of 130 beats per minute. Which method of treatment would be most effective in this case?
 A:  Therapy for pulmonary edema
 B:  Surgical embolectomy
 C:  Thrombolysis
 D:  Heparin
 E:  Observation and supportive care

266.query:
Because of his involvement in a motor vehicle accident, a 23-year-old football player has a chest wall injury. The only abnormal findings on clinical and radiologic examination are a fracture of the left fifth to seventh ribs and a small hemothorax. What should treatment include?
 A:  Thoracotomy to treat a hemothorax in the left base
 B:  Insertion of an intercostal drain to avoid pneumothorax
 C:  Insertion of a metal plate to fix the fracture
 D:  Administration of analgesic medication
 E:  Immediate surgical intervention to remove damaged ribs

267.query:
Which one of the following statements concerning chest X-ray in patients with congenital heart diseases is FALSE?
 A:  Always shows an enlarged heart in heart failure
 B:  May show pulmonary oligemia in congenital heart disease
 C:  May show a characteristic heart shadow in Transposition of the great arteries called "egg on a string"
 D:  Shows a characteristic boot-shaped heart shadow in Tetralogy of Fallot
 E:  Is not useful in diagnosing congenital heart diseases
267.answer_content: Always shows an enlarged heart in heart failure

268.query:
A patent ductus arteriosus:
 A:  Can be a cause of heart failure but may also be life-saving
 B:  Causes a left-to-right shunt
 C:  Is uncommonly associated with intraventricular hemorrhage, pulmonary hemorrhage, and necrotizing enterocolitis
 D:  Is normal on day 14 of life
 E:  Spontaneously resolves without any complications

269.query:
A 46-year-old man is diagnosed with an estrogen receptor-positive invasive ductal carcinoma of the right breast after having discovered a lump 3 months before. The patient is found to have multiple involved axillary lymph nodes, and the tumor is of an aggressive phenotype. The most appropriate treatment option for this patient is:
 A:  Cytotoxic chemotherapy and Tamoxifen but no surgery
 B:  Mastectomy + axillary clearance + systemic chemotherapy + radiotherapy and  Tamoxifen
 C:  Wide local excision and Tamoxifen only
 D:  Mastectomy + postoperative radiotherapy only
 E:  Observation without intervention
269.answer_content: Mastectomy + axillary clearance + systemic chemotherapy + radiotherapy and  Tamoxifen

270.query:
A 67-year-old woman with a 25-year smoking history presents to the clinic expressing concerns regarding an increase in the size of her right breast over the last 4 months. On examination, you find a non-tender, mobile, lobulated 10 cm mass with relatively smooth edges in the right breast. The right breast is significantly larger than the left and has a 'teardrop' appearance. The most likely diagnosis here is:
 A:  Inflammatory breast carcinoma
 B:  Breast abscess
 C:  Malignant phyllodes tumor
 D:  Fibroadenoma
 E:  Lipoma

271.query:
Which of the following is TRUE regarding benign prostate hyperplasia and prostate related issues
 A:  All men with BPH demonstrate lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS), and all men with LUTS have BPH
 B:  The risk for acute urinary retention (AUR) increases with age
 C:  Prostate volume typically decreases over time in men with BPH
 D:  Complications such as bladder stones or recurrent urinary tract infections are frequent
 E:  None of the above are true
271.answer_content: The risk for acute urinary retention (AUR) increases with age

272.query:
A 57-year old nulliparous woman comes 2 weeks after noticing a lump in the right breast. Her last mammogram was done 4 years ago and showed no abnormalities. Menopause began 2 years ago, during which time the patient was prescribed hormone replacement therapy for severe hot flashes and vaginal dryness. Vital signs are within normal limits. Examination of the right breast shows a firm, non-tender mass close to the nipple. There are no changes in the skin or nipple and there is no palpable axillary adenopathy. The abdomen is soft and nontender. Mammography shows a suspicious 2 cm mass adjacent to the nipple. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?
 A:  Fine needle aspiration
 B:  Excisional biopsy
 C:  Bone scan
 D:  Measurement of serum CA 15-3
 E:  Core needle biopsy

273.query:
A 29-year old woman comes to the physician for evaluation of a mass in the left breast noticed 2 weeks ago. During this period the mass has not increased in size and has no pain. Three months ago she hit her left chest against a door and it was painful for a day. Menses occur at regular 28 day intervals and last for 5 days. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks ago. Physical examination shows dense breasts and 2.5 cm well defined, rubbery, mobile mass that is non tender in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast. There is no axillary adenopathy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
 A:  Phyllodes tumour
 B:  Intraductal papilloma
 C:  Fibrocystic changes of the breast
 D:  Fibroadenoma
 E:  Fat necrosis

274.query:
A 36-year-old woman who is breastfeeding her first child complains of a smooth, mobile, painless lump in the outer quadrant of the right breast. Core biopsy is attempted and a white opaque fluid is expressed. The most likely diagnosis in this patient is:
 A:  Pregnancy-associated breast cancer
 B:  Fibroadenoma
 C:  Lobular breast cancer
 D:  Galactocele
 E:  Breast abscess

275.query:
A woman undergoes a triple assessment for a left upper outer quadrant breast lump. The results of the clinical assessment show the lump to be 4.5 cm in diameter, with mobile lymph nodes on the same side and no evidence of distant metastases. Which of the following is her TNM classification?
 A:  T1N3M0
 B:  T2N1M0
 C:  T3N0M0
 D:  T2N3M1
 E:  T4N0M0

276.query:
Which of the following statements regarding acute extradural haematoma is False?
 A:  It is often caused by a skull fracture with laceration of the middle meningeal artery
 B:  It commonly occurs at the pterion.
 C:  There is often a lucid interval.
 D:  Treatment is with a burrhole.
 E:  All of the above.

277.query:
A 29-year-old woman attends A&E with a tender, swollen left breast. Her temperature is 38°C. She is two weeks post-partum and is breastfeeding. Ultrasound shows a cystic mass in the left breast. What is the most appropriate next step in management?
 A:  Advise to stop breastfeeding
 B:  Arrange mammograms of both breasts
 C:  Needle aspiration of the collection
 D:  Start bromocriptine
 E:  Continue breastfeeding

278.query:
Which of the following confers an increased risk of breast cancer in women?
 A:  Birth of first child at age <20 years
 B:  Excess alcohol consumption
 C:  Premenopausal obesity
 D:  Regular exercise
 E:  Early menopause

279.query:
The primary tool for the detailed study of the coronary arteries is:
 A:  CT
 B:  MRI
 C:  Angiography
 D:  Scintigraphy
 E:  Ultrasound

280.query:
Which of the following can cause secondary brain injury?
 A:  Hypoxia
 B:  Hypotension
 C:  Raised ICP
 D:  Reduced cerebral perfusion
 E:  All of the above

281.query:
You are the Medical Officer in Accident and Emergency department. A patient with Head Injury presents to you. Which imaging modality will you order in the acute setting:
 A:  A PET CT Scan
 B:  An MRI Of The BRAIN
 C:  An EEG
 D:  A Head CT scan
 E:  A Skull Xray

282.query:
A 78-year-old male presents with low back pain which is worst at night. What would be your next plan of management.
 A:  Put him on analgesics and review him six weeks later
 B:  Refer him to the physical therapist for immediate physiotherapy
 C:  Request for a lumbo-sacral X-ray
 D:  Put him on a Lumbar Corset
 E:  Order a bone scan

283.query:
In an anterior dislocation which nerve is most likely to be injured?
 A:  Musculocutaneous.
 B:  Suprascapular
 C:  Upper or lower subscapular.
 D:  Radial
 E:  Axillary

284.query:
Which of the following compensatory mechanisms maintain normal ICP in the face of an increasing intracranial mass lesion in adults?
 A:  Reduction in venous blood volume
 B:  Increase in skull volume
 C:  Sunsetting eyes
 D:  Increase in CSF production.
 E:  None of the above

285.query:
The following lesions are noted in patients with Recurrent Anterior Shoulder Dislocations 
EXCEPT:
 A:  Hill Sachs Lesion
 B:  Bankart Lesion
 C:  Rotator cuff tear
 D:  Inferior Glenoid Rim Fracture
 E:  Reverse Hill Sachs Lesion

286.query:
A 65-year-old man has had pain in the left hip joint for a few years that has begun to subside but he then has noticed a reduction in the joint range of motion in the same hip. The most useful single thing he should do is?
 A:  Engage in sessions of physiotherapy to loosen the joint
 B:  Start a two-week trial of anti-inflammatory drugs to further reduce the pain
 C:  Test for rheumatoid factor
 D:  Consider hip replacement surgery
 E:  Take an x ray of the pelvis
286.answer_content: Take an x ray of the pelvis

287.query:
The following is true of closed Fractures of the femoral shaft in adults.
 A:  They can only be managed by locked intramedullary nailing
 B:  May need blood transfusion
 C:  Fat embolism
 D:  Traction treatment should not be instituted at home
 E:  They are not associated with significant blood loss

288.query:
A 15-year-old boy presents with a single episode of displacement of his left knee cap while playing football but “it returned” spontaneously.
 A:  Physiotherapy, a knee support and observation would be adequate initial management
 B:  A knee CT scan should be done before definitive management and advice can be given
 C:  A knee arthroscopy is advised
 D:  Immediate surgery is recommended
 E:  All of the above apply
288.answer_content: Physiotherapy, a knee support and observation would be adequate initial management

289.query:
How is cerebral perfusion pressure defined?
 A:  Systolic arterial blood pressure minus diastolic blood pressure
 B:  Systolic arterial blood pressure minus venous pressure
 C:  Mean arterial blood pressure minus venous pressure
 D:  Mean arterial blood pressure minus intracranial pressure (ICP)
 E:  Venous pressure minus ICP
289.answer_content: Mean arterial blood pressure minus intracranial pressure (ICP)

290.query:
Which of the following is an absolute contraindication of open reduction?
 A:  Active infection
 B:  Small-sized fragment
 C:  General medical complications
 D:  Severe scarring of adjacent soft tissues.
 E:  Patient refusal

291.query:
Death 3 days after pelvic fracture is most likely to be due to?
 A:  Hemorrhage
 B:  Pulmonary embolism
 C:  Fat embolism
 D:  Infection
 E:  Renal failure

292.query:
Cerebral autoregulation maintains normal cerebral blood flow in what range of mean arterial blood pressures?
 A:  50–150 mmHg
 B:  50–100mmHg
 C:  25–50 mmHg
 D:  80–200 mmHg
 E:  100–250 mmHg.

293.query:
A patient develops compartment syndrome following manipulation and plaster for fracture of both bones of the leg. What is the best treatment?
 A:  Split the plaster
 B:  Infusion of low molecular weight dextran
 C:  Elevate the leg after splitting the plaster
 D:  Do operative decompression of fasciae compartments
 E:  Apply a cold compress to the leg
293.answer_content: Do operative decompression of fasciae compartments

294.query:
A patient with residual polio paralysis of the rt lower limb may best be managed by;
 A:  Ankle support
 B:  Knee ankle foot orthosis (KAFO)
 C:  Knee immobilizer
 D:  Knee brace
 E:  Physical therapy alone

295.query:
The metabolic energy cost of ambulation is:
 A:  Proportional to dietary intake by the patient
 B:  Proportional to the number of functioning joints
 C:  inversely proportional to the length of the residual limb
 D:  Not related to the type of amputation
 E:  Directly related to the patient's age
295.answer_content: inversely proportional to the length of the residual limb

296.query:
A 45-year-old male patient complains of dysphagia of 2 years’ duration. He seems to have greater difficulty swallowing liquids than solids. Recently he has noticed that at night he is woken up by coughing. He has lost about 7–8 kg in weight in 6 months. The most likely diagnosis in this patient is
 A:  Peptic stricture
 B:  Carcinoma
 C:  Achalasia
 D:  Diffuse oesophageal spasm
 E:  Schatzki’s ring

297.query:
One of the following is the most appropriate indication for Limb amputation
 A:  Mangled limb
 B:  Degloving injury
 C:  Cellulitis
 D:  Chronic pain unresponsive to treatment
 E:  Osteosarcoma

298.query:
A 28-year-old man is brought by ambulance to the emergency department after falling from the roof of his home four hours ago. Upon initial evaluation, he has visible deformities of his bilateral lower extremities and a positive FAST exam. Heart rate is 135, blood pressure 85/58, and urine output is 40 cc over 3 hours. According to ATLS guidelines, what percentage of his blood volume has this patient likely lost?
 A:  <15%
 B:  15-30%
 C:  30-40%
 D:  40-50%
 E:  >50%

299.query:
Which of the following are associated with Graves’ disease?
 A:  Pretibial myxoedema
 B:  Exposure keratitis
 C:  Optic neuropathy
 D:  Chemosis
 E:  All of the above

300.query:
Immobilization of fractures of long bones should include
 A:  Fractured bone only
 B:  Joint involved in the fracture
 C:  Proximal joint
 D:  Both proximal and distal joints
 E:  Distal joint only

301.query:
A 26-year-old male sustains a right mid-shaft Fracture of the femur. Which of the following radiological investigations are important in his management.
 A:  Antero-posterior x-ray view of the Pelvis
 B:  X-ray view of the Right Shoulder
 C:  Antero-posterior view of the Left Femur
 D:  MRI Scan of the Right Femur
 E:  Lateral x-ray view of the Right Femur
301.answer_content: Antero-posterior x-ray view of the Pelvis

302.query:
Surgery is the preferred option of treatment in which of the following cases of thyrotoxicosis?
 A:  A diffuse toxic nodule
 B:  Severe manifestations of Graves’ ophthalmopathy
 C:  Relapse of Graves
 D:  Presence of local compressive symptoms.
 E:  All of the above

303.query:
The Developmentally dysplastic hip is not commonly associated with
 A:  Being African
 B:  The angle of femoral neck ante version
 C:  Breech presentation
 D:  Being Caucasian
 E:  Family history of hip disorders

304.query:
Ankylosing spondylitis mostly affects
 A:  The knee and hip joints
 B:  The costovertebral joints
 C:  Joints of the upper limb
 D:  The small joints of the hands
 E:  None of the above

305.query:
A lady who is 4 months pregnant presents with some pain in her right knee with a swelling that has been increasing slowly in the previous 2 months. There is only a slight decrease in flexion but not much added pain. A radiolucent lesion is noted in the subchondral region of the distal femur.
 A:  It is important to counsel the lady about the possible amputation of the affected femur
 B:  Nothing should be done until the lady delivers her baby
 C:  Urgent surgery of the lesion should be considered
 D:  The patient must be prepared for chemotherapy once her baby is delivered
 E:  MRI should be done immediately
305.answer_content: Urgent surgery of the lesion should be considered

306.query:
Which of the following are true regarding medical therapy for thyrotoxicosis?
 A:  Propranolol and nadolol reduce free T3 (fT3) and free T4 (fT4) levels.
 B:  Antithyroid drugs most often cure thyrotoxicosis due to a toxic nodule.
 C:  Carbimazole can be safely given in pregnancy and lactation.
 D:  Agranulocytosis is an uncommon problem with antithyroid drugs.
 E:  Patients with ophthalmopathy respond best to medical management
306.answer_content: Agranulocytosis is an uncommon problem with antithyroid drugs.

307.query:
In the treatment of bone and joint infection, it is true
 A:  That the results of culture and sensitivity may not be reliable
 B:  That the causative agent be identified before starting treatment
 C:  That treatment can be successful if done so empirically
 D:  Staph aureus is the most commonly cultured organism
 E:  All the above
307.answer_content: Staph aureus is the most commonly cultured organism

308.query:
The buckling knee may be due to the following except:
 A:  Chronic patella tendon rapture
 B:  Meniscal tear
 C:  Patella alta
 D:  A loose body in the knee
 E:  ACL injury

309.query:
Acute osteomyelitis is commonly caused by:
 A:  S pyogenes
 B:  H. Influenza
 C:  Staph aureus
 D:  Salmonella
 E:  None of the above

310.query:
A 41-year-old man is seen in clinic with bright red rectal bleeding, seen on the toilet tissue intermittently over the last several months. He is an insurance agent, exercises regularly, and eats a well-balanced diet. He denies changes in bowel habits. Family history is unremarkable. His vital signs are normal. His abdomen exam is normal. Digital rectal exam is normal, and blood is identified on the examining finger. Anoscopy shows no other pathology. What is the next best step in diagnosis?
 A:  Fecal occult blood test
 B:  Complete blood count (CBC): if normal, no further evaluation is indicated
 C:  Barium enema
 D:  Flexible sigmoidoscopy
 E:  Colonoscopy

311.query:
A 50-year-old woman is seen in clinic because of weight loss, restlessness, and palpitations. She also has noted leg swelling and excessive hair loss. Her past medical history is unremarkable. She takes no medications. She is afebrile. On exam, she is tachycardic and has a fine tremor. She has mild exophthalmos. Her thyroid is smooth and uniformly enlarged. TSH levels are low and T 3 and T 4 levels are elevated. What is the next best step in management?
 A:  Radioactive iodine
 B:  Early operation
 C:  Propranolol
 D:  Antithyroid medication
 E:  Thyroxine suppression

312.query:
A 20-year-old woman is seen in clinic because of a thyroid nodule. She is asymptomatic and her past medical history is unremarkable. She takes no medications. There is a 1-cm fi rm, solitary, nodule in
the lateral aspect of the left lobe of the thyroid. A radionuclide scan showed no uptake of tracer in the nodule. Ultrasonography shows a solid, homogenous 1-cm mass. Fine-needle aspiration cytology
shows a follicular neoplasm. What is the next best step in management?
 A:  Irradiation (radioactive iodine)
 B:  Thyroid suppression with thyroxine
 C:  Incisional biopsy and enucleation if benign
 D:  Total thyroidectomy
 E:  Left thyroid lobectomy

313.query:
74-year-old man has a recent diagnosis of adenocarcinoma of the distal esophagus. He has a long history of reflux and Barrett’s esophagus, and a recent upper endoscopy and biopsies confirmed the diagnosis. A staging workup is planned. What is the best study for assessing T (tumor invasion depth)?
 A:  Barium swallow
 B:  CT scan with oral and intravenous contrast
 C:  Upper endoscopy with rebiopsy
 D:  Positron emission tomography (PET) scan
 E:  Endoscopic ultrasound

314.query:
The sequestrum in X-ray appears:
 A:  Light
 B:  Dense
 C:  Isodense as surrounding
 D:  Transparent
 E:  Any of the above

315.query:
The risk of death and recurrent bleeding from a controlled upper GIT lesion is highest in
 A:  An 80-year male following an accidentally swallowed fish-bone esophageal injury
 B:  A cirrhotic person with varices managed with a liver transplant
 C:  A 70 year female with bleeding gastric ulcer resuscitated with 4 pints of blood before sclerotherapy
 D:  A duodenal ulcer noted to have a black spot covering the base on endoscopy
 E:  A patient with a Mallory-Weiss tear
315.answer_content: A 70 year female with bleeding gastric ulcer resuscitated with 4 pints of blood before sclerotherapy

316.query:
The Saint’s triad describes the occurrence of flatulent dyspepsia associated with the following except
 A:  Diverticulosis
 B:  Hiatus hernia
 C:  Peptic ulceration
 D:  Gallstones
 E:  None of the above

317.query:
Which of the following is not a function of skin?
 A:  Immunological
 B:  Vitamin E synthesis
 C:  Physical barrier
 D:  UV protection
 E:  Sensory perception

318.query:
A Z-plasty is an example of
 A:  An advancement flap
 B:  A delayed flap
 C:  An island pedicle flap
 D:  A rotational flap
 E:  A free flap

319.query:
A 65-year-old man sustains a 50% TBSA burn while burning trash in the backyard. The patient is resuscitated with lactated Ringer (LR) solution using the Parkland formula and a weight of 80 kg. What is the rate of LR given in the first 8 hours?
 A:  100 mL/h
 B:  500 mL/h
 C:  1000 mL/h
 D:  5000 mL/h
 E:  2000 mL/h

320.query:
On risk factors for breast cancer:
 A:  BRCA 1 and BRCA 2 genes risk for breast cancer is about 30-40%
 B:  Breast cancer is twice as common in females
 C:  Breast cancer is commoner among cousins than the general population
 D:  Alcohol consumption does not increase the risk of breast cancer
 E:  Breast cancer is commoner in white race than in black race
320.answer_content: Breast cancer is commoner in white race than in black race

321.query:
The symptoms of hyperparathyroidism include:
 A:  Constipation and muscle weakness
 B:  Anorexia and weight loss
 C:  Polydipsia and polyuria
 D:  All of the above
 E:  None of the above

322.query:
The nurse in the ward informs you that a patient developed difficulties in breathing and neck swelling 4 hours after thyroidectomy. You are the medical intern on call. What is the next step in the management of this patient?
 A:  Give oxygen by mask and observe
 B:  Call the anesthetist to intubate the patient
 C:  Prepare the patient for emergency tracheostomy
 D:  Remove all the stitches and call the surgeon on duty
 E:  Administer intravenous steroids
322.answer_content: Remove all the stitches and call the surgeon on duty

323.query:
Which of the following is not a risk factor for melanoma?
 A:  Total nevus count
 B:  Natural red or blonde hair
 C:  Prior blistering sunburn
 D:  Family history of melanoma
 E:  Low socioeconomic status

324.query:
Which of the following statements is false regarding direct inguinal hernias?
 A:  The most likely cause is the destruction of connective tissue as a result of physical stress.
 B:  Direct hernias should be repaired promptly because of the risk of incarceration.
 C:  A direct hernia may be a sliding hernia involving a portion of the bladder wall.
 D:  A direct hernia may pass through the external inguinal ring
 E:  They are less common than indirect hernias
324.answer_content: Direct hernias should be repaired promptly because of the risk of incarceration.

325.query:
In the setting of an equivocal examination, which of these ones has the greatest sensitivity in diagnosing an inguinal hernia?
 A:  Ultrasound
 B:  Ct scan
 C:  X-ray
 D:  MRI
 E:  Physical examination

326.query:
Which of the following is of least concern when preparing a jaundiced patient for a triple bypass surgery?
 A:  Deranged renal functions and urine output
 B:  DVT prophylaxis using low molecular weight heparin
 C:  increased risk of wound infections
 D:  increased nutritional requirements for albumin and glucose before surgery
 E:  Liver enzyme levels
326.answer_content: DVT prophylaxis using low molecular weight heparin

327.query:
You are asked to take consent for a laparoscopic cholecystectomy in a 40-year-old female with acute cholecystitis. What would you ensure the patient understands about the procedure?
 A:  You recommend laparoscopy as it has less anesthetic risks than open surgery
 B:  The need for DVT prevention  is much less in laparoscopic than in open surgery
 C:  An open laparotomy may end up being performed without further consent if need be
 D:  The immediate  cost of laparoscopy is cheaper than that of open surgery
 E:  The recovery time is significantly shorter with laparoscopy
327.answer_content: An open laparotomy may end up being performed without further consent if need be

328.query:
A 28-year-old man comes to clinic because of an inguinal hernia. He works as a stonemason and first noticed the hernia when he developed a painful bulge while lifting a bag of cement. He has otherwise been healthy and takes no medications. An open inguinal hernia repair with mesh has been recommended. During a discussion of the anticipated risks, which of the following represents the most common complication?
 A:  Recurrence
 B:  Urinary retention
 C:  Reduced fertility
 D:  Chronic pain
 E:  Ischemic orchitis

329.query:
As a medical superintendent of a hospital initiating laparoscopic surgery, the critical equipment to procure would include the following except
 A:  Gas insufflation systems
 B:  High-intensity light source and camera systems
 C:  Basic laparoscopic hand instruments
 D:  Video recording and image storage devices
 E:  None of the above
329.answer_content: Video recording and image storage devices

330.query:
32-year-old man comes to the emergency department with an acutely incarcerated inguinal hernia. With sedation, the hernia is reduced and he feels better. Eighteen hours later, he complains of increasing abdominal pain and has diffuse tenderness on examination. He most likely had which of the following?
 A:  Diastasis recti
 B:  Petit’s (lumbar) hernia
 C:  Epigastric hernia
 D:  Amyand’s hernia
 E:  Richter’s hernia

331.query:
A competent lower oesophageal junction prevents the reflux of gastric contents into the esophagus. This function is compromised when
 A:  The length of the sphincter is 3 cm or more
 B:  The sphincter complex is drawn into the distal oesophagus due to oesophageal fibrosis
 C:  The resting pressure of the sphincter is at 20mmHg
 D:  A previously obese person loses excess weight
 E:  The lower esophageal sphincter relaxes
331.answer_content: The sphincter complex is drawn into the distal oesophagus due to oesophageal fibrosis

332.query:
Hypospadias is always associated with
 A:  Ventral Chordee
 B:  Dorsal hood
 C:  Micro penis
 D:  Dorsal penile opening of the urethra
 E:  Urethral fistula

333.query:
A 46-year-old man comes to your office 6 months after an open inguinal hernia repair complaining of pain, which has never resolved after his surgery. On further questioning, he complains of radicular pain into the testicle, which worsens with sitting for longer than 10 minutes. On exam, he is hyperesthetic overlying his scar and has numbness over the ipsilateral scrotum and medial thigh. All else is normal. Injury to which nerve is the most likely cause for his pain?
 A:  Femoral nerve
 B:  Hypogastric nerve
 C:  Lateral femoral cutaneous nerve
 D:  Ilioinguinal nerve
 E:  Vagus nerve

334.query:
Congenital disorders of the genito-urinary system can be easily diagnosed incidentally prenatally using the following investigation
 A:  Obstetric Ultrasound
 B:  Amniocentesis
 C:  Fetal CT
 D:  Maternal Urinalysis
 E:  MRI

335.query:
In testicular hematoma from scrotal trauma, where does it collect?
 A:  Datos layer
 B:  Skin
 C:  Tunica space
 D:  Intratesticular
 E:  Subcutaneous tissue

336.query:
Which of the following is a complication of undescended testes?
 A:  Testicular Torsion
 B:  Epididymo-orchitis
 C:  Infertility
 D:  Seminoma development
 E:  All the above

337.query:
Which one of the following is NOT TRUE about balanitis xerotica obliterans?
 A:  It is pre-malignant
 B:  Patient can present with a complex urethral stricture
 C:  Patient have vitiligo on the glan penis
 D:  Patients do not require long-term follow-up
 E:  It can cause phimosis
337.answer_content: Patients do not require long-term follow-up

338.query:
A 4 weeks old baby boy presents with a history of abdominal swelling and difficulty in passing urine. On evaluation and radiological examination, the baby is found to have posterior urethral valves. The parents seek to know the available treatment options from the doctor. All of the following are true except:
 A:  Emergency draining of the urine with a stent
 B:  Vesicostomy is indicated when the baby is stable
 C:  Abrasion of the posterior urethral valves when the baby is stable
 D:  Continuous monitoring of renal function is necessary
 E:  Urethroplasty is indicated

339.query:
A 34-year-old male patient presents in casualty with right lower abdominal pain. The patient is evaluated and a CT scan urogram confirms a 2 mm calculi in the right ureter at vesico-ureteric junction. Patient is referred to a urologist for advice. All of the following are true advice 
EXCEPT:
 A:  Patient can be managed conservatively as he is being followed up in the clinic
 B:  Patient is advised to maintain good hydration
 C:  Renal function test are important while on follow-up
 D:  Pain management is critical
 E:  Emergency ureterolithotomy is indicated

340.query:
Which of the following is NOT a complication of an ostomy?
 A:  Intestinal prolapse through the stoma
 B:  Peri-stomal hernia
 C:  Bleeding caused by peri-stomal carcinomas
 D:  Skin irritation
 E:  Intestinal stricture

341.query:
A patient has 5 days of vomiting and generalized, colicky pain. Radiological examination is consistent with your diagnosis of small bowel obstruction. The blood work shows the following: WBC is 12.0, Cr 2.0 (normal <1.1), Na 130, K 2.5, Cl 90 BUN 18. What is your next step in management? 
 

 
.
 A:  Immediate surgery as she has confirmed bowel obstruction with an elevated WBC and renal failure and likely gangrenous bowel and continue resuscitation post-operatively.
 B:  Immediate resuscitation with 2.0 L bolus of normal saline, IV K replacement with 20 MeQ bolus immediately, and a blood transfusion if HGB is below normal to minimize fluid required and then consider surgery.
 C:  Immediate resuscitation with normal saline or ringer’s lactate in 1.0L boluses until urine output established K replacement after urine output confirmed, check Hgb level and cross-match for possible transfusion and then consider surgery.
 D:  Fluid boluses of 2.0L or more of normal saline with concurrent vasopressor treatment to maintain normal blood pressure to maintain kidney perfusion as she is in renal failure and severely dehydrated and then consider surgery
 E:  Surgical consultation and planning for possible resection
341.answer_content: Immediate resuscitation with 2.0 L bolus of normal saline, IV K replacement with 20 MeQ bolus immediately, and a blood transfusion if HGB is below normal to minimize fluid required and then consider surgery.

342.query:
In a child with a known mediastinal mass which of the following signs and symptoms would be the most compelling indication for emergency admission?
 A:  Fever
 B:  Stridor
 C:  Splenomegaly
 D:  Cervical lymphadenopathy
 E:  Weight loss

343.query:
Which of the following is NOT associated with the long-term use of warfarin?
 A:  Teratogenicity
 B:  Thrombocytopenia
 C:  Cerebral vascular hemorrhage
 D:  Poor compliance
 E:  Osteoporosis

344.query:
Which of the following is NOT a sign to look for in diagnosing suspected deep venous thrombosis?
 A:  Homan’s sign
 B:  Unilateral leg swelling
 C:  Tenderness in the calf
 D:  Palpable cord
 E:  Warmth over the area

345.query:
Which of the following statements about achalasia cardia is true?
 A:  Is associated with hyperplasia of the lower oesophageal sphincter
 B:  Is due to the absence of ganglion cells in Auerbach's plexus
 C:  Most frequently presents in childhood
 D:  Barium swallow is NOT useful in making the diagnosis
 E:  It improves with age

346.query:
In congenital heart disease the most common defect among the following is;
 A:  Atrial septal defect
 B:  Tetrallogy of Fallot
 C:  Ventricular septal defect
 D:  Dextrocardia
 E:  Pulmonary atresia

347.query:
Which of the following is not a component of the Pentalogy of Cantrell?
 A:  Pericardial Cyst
 B:  Ectopic cordis
 C:  Sternal cleft
 D:  Intracardiac defect
 E:  Omphalocele

348.query:
A neonate has excessive salivation and respiratory distress. Attempts to pass a nasogastric catheter fails because it coils at the back of the throat. A chest film shows a gasless abdomen and right upper lobe atelectasis. The most likely diagnosis is?
 A:  Esophageal atresia without fistula
 B:  Esophageal atresia with distal tracheoesophageal fistula
 C:  “H-type” tracheoesophageal fistula
 D:  Esophageal atresia with proximal and distal fistula
 E:  Diaphragmatic hernia

349.query:
Which one of the following conditions is not frequently associated with polyhydramnios?
 A:  Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
 B:  Esophageal atresia
 C:  Hirschsprung’s disease
 D:  Pyloric atresia
 E:  Anencephaly

350.query:
A newborn full-term baby boy with a diagnosis of imperforate anus is also at risk to have which one of the following deformities?
 A:  Dextrocardia
 B:  Rib cage anomaly
 C:  Tracheoesophageal fistula
 D:  Ulnar skeletal deformity
 E:  Limb anomalies

351.query:
A 19-year-old man is seen in the emergency department 20 minutes after a high-speed head-on collision with a tree, in which his car caught fire. He was not wearing a seat belt and was ejected from the vehicle. In the emergency department, he is alert, but he does not remember what happened. He admits to drinking a few beers earlier. Blood pressure is 75/40 mmHg and heart rate 140. His airway is patent. Breath sounds are equal bilaterally. Arterial blood gases reveal a Pa O 2 of 140, Sa O 2 of 98%, Pa CO 2 of 34, and p H of 7.33. He has burns to 15% TBSA, involving his anterior trunk and legs. His abdomen is covered with burns but appears distended; tenderness is hard to determine because of painful burn wounds. What is the most likely cause of his hypotension?
 A:  Smoke inhalation injury
 B:  Burn shock
 C:  Intra-abdominal hemorrhage
 D:  Ethanol intoxication
 E:  Closed head injury

352.query:
Which ONE of the following structures is not responsible for the production of CSF?
 A:  Subependymal blood vessels
 B:  Pia matter
 C:  Choroid plexus
 D:  Astrocytes
 E:  Neuronal cells

353.query:
Which of the following statements regarding the clinical features of intestinal obstruction is true
 A:  Vomiting occurs early in high small bowel obstruction
 B:  The development of severe pain is indicative of ischemia
 C:  Some patients may pass flatus and feces even after the onset of obstruction
 D:  All of the above
 E:  None of the above

354.query:
Which ONE of the following is not part of prenatal screening of neuro-tube defects?
 A:  Triple screen including alpha-fetoprotein
 B:  Amniocentesis
 C:  Ultrasound
 D:  CT scan
 E:  Fetal MRI

355.query:
What classification is used to assess a patient’s airway for potential difficulty in intubation?
 A:  Mallampati classification
 B:  Garden classification
 C:  Salter-Harris classification
 D:  ASA classification
 E:  n/a

356.query:
Breast hypertrophy
 A:  Is most prevalent in older premenopousal women
 B:  Is commonly treated with augumentation mammoplasty
 C:  Is associated with low sensitivity of the breast tissue to oestrogen.
 D:  Can benefit from reduction mammoplasty
 E:  Requires hormone therapy

357.query:
40-year-old woman presented with an ulcerated breast lump measuring 10 X 10 cm. Trucut biopsy showed benign cystosarcoma phylloides tumour. What is the treatment of choice in this case?
 A:  Wide exciscion
 B:  Quadrantectomy
 C:  Simple mastectomy
 D:  Microdochectomy
 E:  Chemotherapy

358.query:
The abdominal organ most susceptible to injury following blunt trauma is
 A:  The esophagus
 B:  The spleen
 C:  Pancreas
 D:  Small bowel
 E:  The aorta

359.query:
Which one of the following statements is TRUE about the treatment of intestinal obstructions?
 A:  A child with acute intestinal obstruction due to A. lumbricoides should be dewormed through the NGT immediately to relieve the obstruction.
 B:  A child with acute intestinal obstruction due to Hirchisprungs’ disease should be treated by immediate laparotomy and resection of the aganglionic segment
 C:  A patient with acute intestinal obstruction due to adhesions for one day should be treated by immediate laparotomy for adhesiolysis
 D:  Early acute intestinal obstruction due to sigmoid volvulus is best treated by endoscopic decompression and delayed or elective resection of the sigmoid colon
 E:  Conservative management is preferred in all cases
359.answer_content: Early acute intestinal obstruction due to sigmoid volvulus is best treated by endoscopic decompression and delayed or elective resection of the sigmoid colon

360.query:
Concerning the parietal peritoneum which of the following statements is true
 A:  The parietal peritoneum is innervated by somatic nerves
 B:  The parietal peritoneum is innervated by autonomic nerves
 C:  Pain originating in the parietal peritoneum is poorly localized
 D:  Pain from the parietal peritoneum cannot be perceived.
 E:  n/a
360.answer_content: The parietal peritoneum is innervated by somatic nerves

361.query:
A patient presents with small bowel obstruction and a history of appendectomy 10 years ago. She is given fluid, an NGT tube, and a Foley catheter. What are the clinical signs or symptoms that indicate the need for surgery?
 A:  Vomiting
 B:  Constipation
 C:  Peritonitis
 D:  Abdominal distension
 E:  Abdominal tenderness

362.query:
A 16-year form 2 student at Starehe Boy Centre, from Lokichogio, is admitted at Kiambu Hospital with abdominal distention with cystic liver mass with septations. Intraoperatively, a cystic mass with daughter cysts was identified. Partial cystectomy done. What is the most appropriate postoperative management of this condition?
 A:  Metronidazole for 10days
 B:  Praziquantel for 5 days
 C:  Albendazole for 28 days
 D:  Mebendazole for 28 days
 E:  Surgical re-exploration

363.query:
Which statement about acute acalculous cholecystitis is NOT correct?
 A:  The disease is often accompanied by or associated with other conditions
 B:  The diagnosis is often difficult
 C:  The mortality rate is higher than that for acute calculous cholecystitis
 D:  All these statements are are correct
 E:  None of the statements are correct
363.answer_content: All these statements are are correct

364.query:
A 20 year-old female was involved in a road traffic trauma and was rushed to the casualty because of massive external bleeding. Her estimated weight was 40 kg. The patient’s estimated total blood volume (TBV) was 1,750 mls. Initially, six units of p RBCs were given followed by another 9 units given over the next 2 hours. Two doses of FFP (10 ml/kg) were also administered. What is the next appropriate step with regard to the patient’s developing dilutional coagulopathy?
 A:  Order PT, aPTT, platelet count, and fibrinogen level STAT and order more FFP (10 ml/kg), platelets (10 ml/kg), and 3 pooled units of cryoprecipitate.
 B:  Order platelets (10 ml/kg) and more FFP (10 ml/kg) x 3 doses.
 C:  Order platelets only and then PT, aPTT, fibrinogen.
 D:  Order more pRBCs (emergency release) and give platelets (10 ml/kg), then  order more FFP (10 ml/kg).
 E:  Administer vitamin K and continue to monitor coagulation parameters.
364.answer_content: Order PT, aPTT, platelet count, and fibrinogen level STAT and order more FFP (10 ml/kg), platelets (10 ml/kg), and 3 pooled units of cryoprecipitate.

365.query:
Which amino acids are predominantly produced in stress from skeletal muscle breakdown? a)
 A:  Arginine and glutamine
 B:  Glutamine and alanine
 C:  Alanine and lysine
 D:  Lysine and tyrosine
 E:  Valine and leucine

366.query:
Which of the following statements are FALSE with respect to performing thoracentesis?
 A:  The patient should be positioned sitting at the edge of the bed, leaning forward, with their arms resting on a table
 B:  Once the level of effusion is determined by clinical exam, the site of needle entry should be 1 to 2 intercostal spaces below the level of effusion
 C:  The needle should be inserted along the superior edge of the rib in order to avoid  injury to the intercostal vessels and nerve
 D:  A chest X-ray is mandatory before and after the procedure.
 E:  The needle may be inserted at any level along the hemithorax midline
366.answer_content: The needle may be inserted at any level along the hemithorax midline

367.query:
Which ONE of the following is the main treatment difference between cancer of the colon and cancer of the rectum?
 A:  There is no difference both are treated primarily with surgical excision that includes the mesentery to remove all draining nodes before any other treatment
 B:  Colon cancer requires chemoradiation if the nodes are positive but rectal cancer requires only radiation if the nodes are positive
 C:  Rectal cancer, but not colon cancer, should always be considered for preoperative neoadjuvant chemoradiation as it confers a survival advantage and increases the chance of negative margins with surgery.
 D:  Colon cancer does not respond to chemotherapy
 E:  Rectal cancer can often be treated with local excision while colon cancer requires more extensive resection.
367.answer_content: Rectal cancer, but not colon cancer, should always be considered for preoperative neoadjuvant chemoradiation as it confers a survival advantage and increases the chance of negative margins with surgery.

368.query:
A young man has severe abdominal pain, a temperature of 39.0 C, a heart rate of 120, and a BP of 95/60. On abdominal examination, he has involuntary guarding and no bowel sounds. Which of the following are the best next steps of resuscitation for this patient with severe sepsis?
 A:  Give 1.0L bolus of normal saline, IV ceftriaxone, and flagyl, place O2 via nasal prongs.
 B:  Give 20 ml/kg bolus of crystalloid, IV Keflex and flagyl, place a foley catheter and admit to ICU
 C:  Give blood transfusion if Hgb <11, 1.0L bolus of D5W and IV  clindamycin
 D:  Give norepinephrine to keep BP> 100, give crystalloid fluid at maintenance and IV antibiotics.
 E:  Give 10 ml/kg bolus of crystalloid and broad-spectrum IV antibiotics
368.answer_content: Give 1.0L bolus of normal saline, IV ceftriaxone, and flagyl, place O2 via nasal prongs.

369.query:
A 48-year-old diabetic man, who has already undergone an amputation of his left foot from gangrene last year, presents with three days history of bloody diarrhoea. What would be the clinical symptoms he would exhibit that would suggest he has a vascular cause of his GI bleeding?
 A:  Early satiety with weight loss but without abdominal pain
 B:  Recent travel history with consumption of lake water as diabetics are more susceptible to water-borne infections
 C:  Chronic history of recurring bouts of bloody diarrhoea with pain and occasional jaundice
 D:  Presence of claudication symptoms in the lower extremities
 E:  Post-prandial peri-umbilical pain and cramping with weight loss from food avoidance
369.answer_content: Post-prandial peri-umbilical pain and cramping with weight loss from food avoidance

370.query:
A 39-year-old male presents with severe epigastric abdominal pain and vomiting. He prefers to sit bending forward. He has a tinge of jaundice and his abdomen is tender with an echymotic periumbilical region. What should be considered in this patient’s evaluation?
 A:  A perforated duodenal ulcer is the most likely cause of his pain
 B:  Associated fever and joint pains would exclude an autoimmune  aetiology of his condition
 C:  History of a preceding endoscopic procedure is significant in the history taking
 D:  A low  serum calcium report is of aetiological significance in his laboratory workup
 E:  Pancreatitis is an unlikely cause
370.answer_content: History of a preceding endoscopic procedure is significant in the history taking

371.query:
What GCS defines moderate head injury in a patient? with the following GCS a) 13 – 15
 A:  9 – 12
 B:  3 – 8
 C:  10 - 12
 D:  None of the above
 E:  n/a

372.query:
What is the commonest source of metastasis to the brain?
 A:  Breast
 B:  Skin
 C:  Genito-urinary system
 D:  Gastrointestinal tract
 E:  Lung

373.query:
A 65 yrs old male present with severe low back pain and weakness of both lower limb. He also has history of straining to pass urine. On evaluation, he is found to have PSA of 50 ng/ml and a lumbasacral x-ray shows sclerotic lesion on the lumbar vertebrae. The patient is advised to undergo more evaluation to confirm his sickness. All the following are true about evaluation test EXCEPT?
 A:  Prostatic trucut biopsy is indicated to confirm his disease
 B:  More radiological test are required to evaluate the extent of the disease
 C:  Urethral catheterization is indicated to monitor his urine output
 D:  Renal function
 E:  None of the above
373.answer_content: Urethral catheterization is indicated to monitor his urine output

374.query:
Bilateral renal tumours can be associated with all except?
 A:  Papillary carcinoma
 B:  No Hematuria
 C:  Wilm’stumours
 D:  Congenital diseases
 E:  All of the above

All the following causes thyrotoxicosis except?
 A:  Diffuse toxic goitre
 B:  Toxic nodule
 C:  Toxic nodular goitre
 D:  Thyroiditis
 E:  Thyroid enlargement

376.query:
A 25-year old woman, injured in a motor vehicular crash is admitted to the emergency department Hi pupils react sluggishly and his eyes open to painful stimuli. He does not follow commands but she moans periodically. His right arm is deformed and does not respond to painful stimulus; however, his left hand reaches purposefully toward the painful stimulus. Both legs are extended. His GCS score is
 A:  2
 B:  4
 C:  6
 D:  9
 E:  12

377.query:
the first step to improve oxygenation in a patient with chest trauma is
 A:  Intubate the patient
 B:  Assess arterial blood gases
 C:  Administer supplemental oxygen
 D:  Ascertain the need for chest tube
 E:  Obtain a chest radiograph

378.query:
